content: Currently, the most widely used alternative energy source is hydropower. Hydropower represents approximately 16% of global electricity production, making it the world's largest source of renewable energy. It is followed by wind energy (5.5%) and solar energy (2%). However, the use of renewable energy sources is growing rapidly, with solar and wind energy taking an increasing share of the market. The use of biomass and geothermal energy is also growing in certain areas, as the technology advances and becomes more efficient.
